nl.utwente.iapc.IAPConnect4.server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • nl.utwente.iapc.IAPConnect4.server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Thread
    Class describes a Server, which can have ClientHandlers, handling clients from over the Internet. It also facilitates assigning Games to ClientHandlers, so they can play a Game by themselves.
    Author:
    Martijn & Axel

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(int port)
        Starts a Server on the given port. This will accept new Clients, creating new ClientHandlers to handle them. It will also after each ready change from a Client check if a new Game can be made. It also holds all ClientHandlers and Games currently playing.
        Parameters:
        port - port to start the Server on.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Thread wrapper function for startServer().
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
        Starts the actual handling of new Clients, creating ClientHandlers for them, and starting these in their own Thread.

      • broadcastCommand

        public void broadcastCommand(Command c)
        Broadcasts a Command to all Clients connected to this Server.
        Parameters:
        c - Command to send

      • availablePlayers

        public java.util.LinkedList<ClientHandler> availablePlayers()
        Returns a list of Players that are connected, not in a Game, and ready for a new Game.
        Returns:
        list of available players.

      • checkForNewGame

        public void checkForNewGame()
        Starts a new Game if availablePlayers().size() => 2. Adds this Game to these ClientHandlers.

      • findClient

        public ClientHandler findClient(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a ClientHandler for the given username, or null if it does not exist.
        Parameters:
        name - username of the requested ClientHandler
        Returns:
        ClientHandler instance with the player having the requested username.

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand(java.lang.String clientName,
                        Command c)
                 throws InvalidCommandException
        Sends the given Command to the player with the given username. Will throw an InvalidCommandException if no player with the given username exists on this Server.
        Parameters:
        clientName - Client's name we want to send the Command to
        c - Commandd to send
        Throws:
        InvalidCommandException - On unknown username

      • removeClient

        public void removeClient(ClientHandler ch)
        Removes the given ClientHandler.
        Parameters:
        ch -

      • stopServer

        public void stopServer()
        Stops the Server, closing all the connections with the Players gracefully through ClientHandler.closeConnection(). It also closes the ServerSocket associated after a second.

      • getServerSocket

        public java.net.ServerSocket getServerSocket()
        Getter for the ServerSocket UML.
        Returns:
        ServerSocket instance.

      • getGames

        public java.util.LinkedList<Game> getGames()
        Getter for the Games UML.
        Returns:
        LinkedList instance with Games.

      • isExiting

        public boolean isExiting()
        Whether the client will exit UML.
        Returns:
        .

      • getClients

        public java.util.LinkedList<ClientHandler> getClients()
        Getter for all Clients UML.
        Returns:
        LinkedList instance with ClientHandlers
